    • Uses of SimilarityMetric in eu.monnetproject.translation.topics.sim

      Classes in eu.monnetproject.translation.topics.sim that implement SimilarityMetric 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BetaLMImpl 
      class  LinearSurjection 
      class  MinErrorSurjection 
      class  WxWCLESA
      Notation: W: Size of vocabulary across all languages J: Number of documents in train set X: The JxW matrix, such that x[w,j] = #{word w is in document j in the source language} Y: The JxW matrix, such that y[w,j] = #{word w is in document j in the target language} D(X): A WxW diagonal matrix, whose values are the inverse document frequencies of X Standard CLESA can thus be defined as clesa(x,y) = cosSim( X D(X) x, Y D(Y) y ) The vector of a word w is given by X D(X) i_w where i_ww = 1, i_ww' = 0 if w != w' The mapping of all such vectors is given by X D(X) I = X D(X) Hence the word-mapped translation vector similarity is wxwclesa(x,y) = cosSim( [ (Y D(Y))^T , X D(X) x ] , y ) where [ A, x ] yields a vector of the cos-sim of the columns of A with x i.e., [A,x] = A norm^-1(A) x / norm(x) where norm is the (by-column) 2-norm
      Methods in eu.monnetproject.translation.topics.sim that return SimilarityMetric 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SimilarityMetric BetaLMSimilarityFactory.makeMetric(ParallelBinarizedReader data, int W)
